definition: to putter around/to work to no avail

sentences.english: 10/Aunt Mary was never one to fuss about unimportant things.
sentences.chinese: 瑪麗姑媽永遠不會在不重要的事情上瞎忙。

sentences.english: My uncle tinkered about in the kitchen.
We spent the whole morning just messing about.
sentences.chinese: 我們瞎忙了整整一個上午。

sentences.english: Stop fussing about and sit down.
sentences.chinese: 別瞎忙了，坐下來休息吧。

sentences.english: He seemed to be working hard, but was just running round in circles.
sentences.chinese: 他看起來工作很緊張，其實不過是在瞎忙一氣。

sentences.english: If you keep fussing about, we're sure to is late.
sentences.chinese: 你要是總瞎忙個沒完，我們非遲到不可。

sentences.english: My mother fusses about all the time, which nearly drives me crazy.
sentences.chinese: 我母親老是瞎忙，差點沒把我逼瘋。

definition: in a busy and hasty manner
to rush/in a hurry/to worry about being late
to have nothing to do/to idle one's time away (idiom)
to waste time on worthless activities
see 做一天和尚撞一天鐘|做一天和尚撞一天钟[zuo4 yi1 tian1 he2 shang5 zhuang4 yi1 tian1 zhong1]
pinyin: dang1 yi1 tian1 he2 shang5 zhuang4 yi1 tian1 zhong1

definition: to tire oneself out through overwork/to work oneself to death
to snatch a moment of leisure/to take a break from work
satisfied just to get through (idiom); to muddle through/without high ambitions, but getting by
